A lot of the runs were narrow.  Trail grooming was poor.  Too much ice, not enough snow.  When an old lady that was out of control ran into my wife, nobody stopped to help or inquire if anybody was  hurt.  Facilities were nice and it's new but the ski experience was definitely not up to US standards.  I won't be back.

Love this site we have been coming here for 4 years now.  we go for dinner at night to nearby St Martin en Re by bicycle and after dinner cycle back - excellent location!

The camping cars are not all squashed in as we have seen at other sites here!  there is plenty of room, toilets and showers are spotless.

I would highly recommend this site and will be definitely be coming back next year!

The people who run it and on reception (not too sure if they are husband and wife) were really helpful and spoke a good bit of English (our French is really limited).

So it's a 5 star all round from us - you would not be disappointed.

We are from Northern Ireland (Jim & Jenni Larkham)

name: La Graineti√®re
location: Route de Saint-martin, 17630 La Flotte en Re, France
comments:
Nice campsite with excellent pool for children and decent wash area. Roads in campsite for kids to cycle around on, and cycle hire available too. Small shop onsite.  1mile into beautiful town centre of La Flotte. 
Only downsides are some queues for facilities, some waits while they we being cleaned and noise from neighbouring campsite and road.  Quite expensive too at ‚Ç¨55 per night for family of 4, tent and electricity. I would recommend.

We stayed for 10 days with 2 small children (plus my sister and her small children) and we had a wonderful time. The mobile homes are fantastic and the facilities in general are top quality. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The swimming pool is excellent and the location of the campsite is great - only a 5 min cycle to La Flotte and 1 mins to Saint Martin! We had a wonderful holiday - we will definitely be back!

Fantastic welcome, friendly owner, pool area amazing, toilet and shower block brand new; all lovely. 4 stars because of road noise from 6am every morning til beyond midnight and no grassy pitches, all dust under pine trees which drop needles etc on your tent. If you can cope with the latter 2 things, it's 5 star to you!
Lovely campsite, one side of the campsite is a bit noisy at night from the nearby road so if you think this might bother you, check what's available when booking?
Stayed here july 17, small and safe, close to La Flotte, would recommend

name: Henne Strand Camping
comments: Very nice campsite. New service buildings. Would definitely go there again.
Very nice camp ground. Very clean and fine facilities, including cooking and cleaning. A lot of activities for children and adults.

Warm Air and Water a small kids pool and a bigger for the swimmer depth 0.75 to 1.5m with a waterslide. Drinks and small snacks can be bought at the cafe. 4 Deckchairs and several tables with chairs. The are no lockers, the shoes have to stay outside in a shelf. The other stuff have to be placed inside the bath. Theres a locker for women and one for men, no family locker.
Very nice place, and exelent facilities. And the host's are super friendly...
Clean and nice sanitary building.

name: Camping ** The Misottes
comments: loved it family friendly clean nice pool for little one and a bar for a drink in evening  will defiantly be going here again

name: Randb√∏ldal Camping
comments: Near Legoland, nature is around and nice cabins with kitchen. It's good that you can wash a laundry asswell. Children's playground is old, but they didn't care it at all. Oh, and the breakfast was very kind and full.

Really worth recommending. Love the place, definitely will visit again.

Rooms are cosy and well furnished, small kitchen inside is fully equipped as well. 

Whole camping site has fast WiFi (fast enough to watch 1080p horrors in the evening). Very high standard public restrooms available 24/7. Artificial lake with small beach and water bikes. Free water slides, table tennis, trampolines and many more. 

Personel speaks English, Danish and Polish. Renting driver's available in reception and by phone. Shop on site open till 10pm serving basic utensils, food and alcohol. 

One thing to notice though, despite what the Google maps says, busses don't stop anywhere near Randb√∏ldal anymore. Renting a driver (180 DKK to town, one way) is the best option for those without campers or cars.
It was really nice  place for kids. Cabins needs some oppgrade tho

name: Camping Les Varennes - Ile de R√©
location: Rue Raise Maritaise, 17580 Le Bois-Plage-en-R√©, France
comments: Fantastic site. Very well maintained and cleaned. Swimming pools are both excellent. Small shop for emergencies with fresh bread, cold drinks and ice creams, but don't rely on it to buy a whole meal. Doesn't charge to freeze icepacks. Lack of noisy entertainment on-site a real bonus. 10 mins walk to the beach, 15 to the market, and a couple of restaurants in walking distance. Pitches sandy but with some shade on most. Highly Recommend!

Starting at 23:00 every night there has been a huge and very noisy firework display here. Thanks for the updated info below. I guess we were lucky/unlucky depending on which way you look at it. Apart from the noisy fireworks, everything here has been great.

This site is perfect for a relaxing week around the pool and beach. Really well laid out so all pitches are close to the amenities. It's busy so we found it occasionally a bit noisy after 10pm but nothing too disastrous. 10 mins easy walk to a beach which slopes gently into the sea, making for very safe bathing. Friendly staff and excellent, clean facilities. There wasn't much to see on Ile de Re (in our opinion) - mainly boring, flat scrubland with a few pretty towns - but we were happy to stay around this site for a fun and relaxing week. Some very minor quibbles - hooks on toilet doors would be good; we were only allowed to book Saturday to Saturday as that's apparently their rule in August, and yet saw other people staying for just a few days; only one device per pitch is allowed on the wi-fi; no signposting on maps or around site for where to dispose of waste water or chemical toilet. But really, the site was fantastic.
Lovely clean campsite,  very quiet but may be the time of the year,  be prepared to do lot's of walking as some distance from the town and beaches unless you have a car
A most enjoyable stay campsite is perfect location wise very clean quiet and friendly

name: Camping Bois Soleil
comments:
It's been better. The showers were generally cold, hardly any hot water during our stay, even going at less busy times.

In previous years you used to have a gardener that swept up the fallen leaves on an almost daily, this year we saw him once in 3-weeks. The site looked a little uncared for. Which is a shame as it is lovely. 

I appreciate we are in France but the previous entertainment crew spoke a mix of Dutch & English which meant everyone could enjoy the show. We have a basic knowledge of French but we struggled to understand which meant we didn't bother going and drank elsewhere. Again it's a shame as it used to be great to sit in the amphitheater and enjoy a few drinks. 

Finally the staff in the shop weren't as nice as those who have been there for the last few years. Rather unfriendly. 

On a positive note your reception staff are lovely, helpful and always greet you with a smile. 

We still plan to come again next year as we love the place.

Styles family holiday. We stayed here for a week. Getting into our pitch was quite tricky as the hedgerows make it quite tight. But we were helped by staff and neighbours alike. There were people who have been coming here for years and years which was good to know. The location is great, right by the beach. The showers were clean, although for the first few days there were issues with hot water (there was none and low pressure) but after 4 days it was sorted. Our 13 yr old son found plenty to do and there were plenty of kids his age. We didn't go to any of the entertainment, although my son did but said it wasn't any good. We didn't use the pool as we spent most of the time on the beach or cycling around exploring. We used their takeaway which was good.
The site could do with having some money spent on it, but we enjoyed our stay and found the campsite very friendly and helpful.

Wonderful stay at Bois Soleil. From the first email to reception, to arrival day and during our stay, we were met with nothing but happy and helpful  staff.  The site itself was clean with large pitches. It's a really pretty site and the pool and beach is a massive plus. The location is great, with the bus stop to Royan only a few minutes walk from site. The shop is really well stocked and they cook baguettes all day long, so you don't have to worry about them running out. All in all we had a fantastic stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay  there again.

Great pitch, close to  beautiful beach. Enjoyable visit to a site with great pitches, close to the beautiful beach. The shop is useful, and the sanitary blocks are good. 
Don't go for gastronomy, though - we could not find a single decent restaurant with parking, locally!
Great stay again. We had a fantastic holiday.  Thank you so much.     See you next year!  We are already counting the days... Merci!

comments:
Un chouette camping avec une super √©quipe d'animation et une belle piscine. Le camping est id√©alement situ√© au centre de Boyardville.
Les animations sont tr√®s bien, pour adultes comme pour enfants, avec une super √©quipe.
La piscine est grande et agr√©able et gros plus: un hammam et un sauna (qui m√©riterait d'√™tre un peu plus chaud).

Deux b√©mols :
- la propret√© de la piscine, particuli√®rement des sanitaires est √† revoir,
- le club enfants n'a pas assez d'animateurs. comments: Its a farm where they keep animals. One of them make scary noises in the middle of the night. It's like it's being hurt. The toilets are barely passing minimal standards... From 2am till 6 am we ha a mole going around our tent trying to get in. It was going around, under us etc. I felt it several times going through my back. Far from nice. We tried everything but wouldn't go away till dawn. We could not sleep. Worst night in a campsite. On the other side people camping there and owners of the campsite are nice and cool. comments: Lovely quiet relatively small park.  We did go at the end of the season so no entertainment which was fine but some music in the bar would have been good for atmosphere. Food in bar great good value and great service.  Pool and tennis tables great. . Whole pool area exceptionally clean and loads of sun beds.  Caravan very clean and good location.  Would have liked toaster and kettle - but that's just the English for you!! All in all fab break with great staff and service.

Amazing staff, extremely helpful and welcoming. Fantastic site with lots of space to put up tents and vehicles. Facilities are the best iv seen in a while with very hot water. Great location. Quiet at night. Would love to have stayed longer. There was fresh bread and croissants in the morning for sale :D

We enjoyed our stay at the camp site, we were in a tent and the pitch was a perfect size. I would recommend hiring bikes to go into the town as we walked and was a little too far for our little girls legs. There is a bus that now runs near the camp site into La Rochelle which is handy but does not run very late. we loved the food in the restaurant but also tried out neighboring restaurants which were also very good along with the oyster shacks along the promenade.  We would stay again.

Great location for the beach, beach 200m away, not as good as the one which takes 20 mins to walk to.

Very sad that the transport links to La Rochelle are so limited as both buses and trains only available at certain times of the day. 

Nice restaurant on site with a range of dishes available.

Very helpful staff in all aspects, reception, bar, shop, showing us to our pitch.

Very friendly English speaking staff, spacious and clean facilities with super hot water.  Particularly like the low level lighting which isn't too intrusive when you're in a tent; spacious pitches with plenty of trees. A couple of minutes walk from the beach and 15 minute drive from La Rochelle.

name: Camping Palmyre Loisirs
location: 28 Avenue des Mathes, 17570 La Palmyre, Poitou-Charentes, France, France
comments: Great camp site. The staff are incredibly helpful and always easy to find. The pool is one of the best we have found with lots of space and quieter areas for young children. The shop is comprehensive though a little on the expensive side, and the take away food & restaurant are delicious. However, I have taken off one star for the music in the evenings, it was unbelievably loud. We were pretty much as far away as it is possible to be and it was still deafening. It starts at 9pm and continues until midnight keeping my 3 yr old & 7 year old awake. If you want a holiday where you can watch cabaret shows every evening then this is the place for you, but if (like us) you go on holiday to relax and come back well rested then maybe invest in some good quality ear plugs. Such a shame really as the rest of the holiday was faultless.
My wife and I spent a few days  very enjoyable.at Camping Palmyre Loisirs  in early September. The site was very clean and the staff friendly

Improvements are taking place at this site and clearly the management are trying hard - but be careful as some mobile homes are being very tightly packed in now and you might get one boxed in on all sides by other homes!
I would live here ;)

This is a perfectly nice campsite on the edge of Tournai.  Although the sign at the gate says max length for caravans is 7 metres, there was no problem with our 7.75 metre motorhome.
The pitches are private with laurel hedges on three sides, electric hookup, grey water outlet and drinking water on each pitch.
We managed to get a pitch about three pitches away from the road so the daytime noise wasn't bad.  As others have advised, try and find one away from the roundabout.  We were allowed to pick any pitch .    
Using my almost long-forgotten schoolboy French I got booked in and had no problems with the man at reception, who reciprocated by throwing in a bit of English when I got totally stuck.
All in all for just over 16 Euros, a site well worth a visit.

comments: AMAZINGLY helpful staff.  Great location (although a bit noisy with background road traffic).  Staying in a little log cabin BUT the overwhelming feeling is HOW WONDERFULLY helpful the staff are.  Giving us ALL sorts of useful information, even ordered our dinner for us online with delivery to our little cabin.  Mighty impressive place (and we've only been here a couple of hours!!  Showers are super hot too :)

I felt like as if I was camping in my friend's farm. The owner and all the kind staffs were eager to help me every possible ways and they even helped me fixing my car's flat tire. To my regret, I did not get their names. Manuel is the only one I remember but the other staffs in the reception desk and the cleaning gentleman were so kind that I even felt sad when I left this camping ground.

Location is great if you are planning to explore Rotterdam. Camping ground is large and well maintained. Shower room is clean and you can borrow a power bank to charge your smartphone in your tent for free. Bicycle rent rate was a lot lower than any other bicycle shops.

Highly recommended to anybody else.
Nice localization but a bit noisy. Well, it is next to highway. Gentle staff.
Great staff, really good transport links to Rotterdam, grassy, level pitches, perfect city camping.

The staff were friendly and helpful, and the showers and toilets were cleaned frequently. The only drawback was the internet, which could only be used for a set number of hours, and required a code for each login. 
The price seemed decent though, and it was situated in a convenient location to getting to the city centre (I walked it in about 40minutes)

name: Camping Capfun
comments:
We stayed during August 2017, originally booked for 12 nights but only got through 6 before leaving.

Our issues started from the moment we arrived. The pitch we were originally assigned wasn't particularly big (maybe 80 sqm) and a strange shape, but it would have been fine if it had a power supply within 30m of the pitch. We had 20m of cable and were nowhere close. Also, the lead would run across an access road which I didn't think was particularly safe. The other issue was the main entertainment marquee was 50m away. We didn't know at this time that this would be a problem, but because of the power supply issue we moved pitches to one we were a lot happier with.

Getting back to the entertainment, this is all in French, including the what's on for the week, and also can go on very late into the night. Whilst the campsite should be quiet by 11pm, the entertainment when we stayed went on past this time on the 4 nights it ran, and one night went on well past midnight. Also, there was a considerable language barrier in the bar, making ordering something quite difficult. You need to be aware of  this as it's not anywhere near as multi lingual as other campsites. That said, this was only a minor annoyance to us.

There was also a security issue in our opinion. The main play area for the children bordered the path by the lake, with a handy gate which appeared to be left open all of the time. Once more, the fence had been pushed down further along. This meant that access into the campsite was easier, or kids getting onto the lake was easy as well. On the plus side, the lake smelt and had high levels of bright green algae so this was not an attractive option for the kids, so they probably wouldn't have wondered in.

Finally, the pools. This was more of a disappointment as younger children have very few options, and the kiddie waterslides both has considerable drops from them into shallow water. On one occasion the indoor pool water level was lowered and the drop from the slide was actually into 2cm of water. For onlder kids this is not an issue and it must be said that the water slides are very good, and the indoor/outdoor pools were good.

So, to summarise, you need to speak French to really enjoy yourself here, don't have young children, the entertainment goes on quite late and the lake smells.

Now we knew it would be loud, but this is a joke. We wanted fun for the kids, not for them to damage their hearing. It's absolutely hideous. Unless you enjoy trying to sleep in a nightclub, avoid this place. I can hardly hear myself crying over the music.

Bij aankomst een iemand bij de receptie die een half woord Engels praat, met handen en voeten en een half woordje frans toch eindelijk bij onze plek gekomen.
Wij waren met twee kleine kinderen van 7 en 9. Aangezien er ook een animatie team aanwezig was dachten wij voor elkaar. Alleen deze praten ook alleen Frans en niemand die de moeite doet om de kinderen tegemoet te komen.....dus dat werdt hem ook niet.
Toen maar een hapje eten bestelt bij de snackbar op de camping en aangegeven dat wij het daar op wilden eten. Toen mensen naast ons "Fransen" hun eten kregen terwijl ze tien minuten later dan ons aankwamen, toch maar even gevraagd waar ons eten bleef.
De dame achter de bar wees naar een paar borden op de bar die er al een tijd stonden en koud waren???? Na veel moeite toch opnieuw een warm bordje eten gekregen....die we dan ook zelf maar bij de bar op moesten halen.
Later op de week 12‚Ç¨ af moeten rekenen voor een pizza van 8‚Ç¨??? Ook hier doen ze net of het aan jouw ligt.
Plek voor de tent is ook erg smal waardoor je de tent in de lengte moet zetten en er dan bijna geen leef ruimte er om heen is.
Hele camping voornamelijk Fransen en er wordt totaal geen rekening met "buitenlanders" gehouden. Al met al eens maar nooit meer. Nationalistisch  volk wat er rond loopt. Elke avond tot een uur of 1 keiharde Franse muziek en luidruchtig volk over de camping, tot onze grote verbazing sluiten de poorten niet 's Avonds en rijden er 's nachts ook gewoon auto's over het terrein. Aan de achter kant van de camping zit een poort maar die staat ook de hele nacht open waardoor iedereen maar op het terrein kan.
Al met al ook heen fijn gevoel.
Tot slot nog de badmeesters die ook alleen Frans praten en eigenlijk meer in het zonnetje liggen dan opletten. Als er dan iets gebeurt dan kan je jezelf niet eens verdedigen en trek je altijd aan het kortste eind. Bv. Toen mijn zoontje een trap van een Frans jongetje kreeg en hij dit terug deed moest mijn zoon het zwembad uit en het andere jongetje mocht  gewoon blijven zwemmen, nou sorry hoor toen was ik er klaar mee. Kan aan mij liggen dat ik niet vloeiend Frans praat maar ik heb m'n best gedaan.....üôÅüò†.
Au revoir.

There is no grassy area. The view across to the lighthouse is very nice however. There is a lack of amenities such as a campers kitchen or washing / vending machines. However work is ongoing here and it has the potential to be a fantastic campsite with a little more work. We will visit again the next time we need a stop over on our way to northern Donegal. More suitable for fully equipped caravans or campers rather than a tent, beware of the very steep hill in and out!

comments:
Nice place. Generally friendly staff. But - rude staff at the pool. There is nothing that spoils fun more than security or lifeguard staff thinking they own the place.

Also reception closes very early - like 9 pm.

name: Camping Les M√ªres
comments:
Again a very pleasant holiday. Our little family stayed with our caravan again in the foresty part of the campsite, very quiet, very nice neighbours, very large patch. Close to bathrooms etc. but not unpleasantly close. Just this time (we stayed in June 2016 as well) we had a sandy/dusty patch and not grass, therefore it was somewhat dirtier and messier. 
We were already prepared for the lacking toilet seats and brought our own, and could be seen walking with our own toilet seat under the arm to the restrooms. Overall, we were very happy about our very nice, albeit short, stay. 
The beach, however, was not as clean as last time, everyday we found and collected considerably large and sharp fresh glass shards and long sharp wires, which could have been very hazardous, especially to our baby. That was not a happy experience, and we expected the beach to be at least raked periodically for such hazards.

Good for mobile homes, not so good for tents. Our stay would be good if it wasn't because of the ants and the street lantern located right next to our place.

They gave us something for the ants, but they returned the next day.

The facilities where good and clean. 

Overall, I would not recommend this camping for people with tents.

Not a great experience, no privacy on pitches. A bit too rustic. British managed and owned I understand. Marginally cheaper than la marina which is also a disappointment.

At least you can book online, unlike its neighbouring site.

Overall, I think the area of grimaud needs updating and has become a little run down in the last 10 years.

I guess it's why so many French now take holidays in Spain, much cheaper too.

Camping was fine, but not very special. The distance to the showers was very far and we also did not know there was no water at our placement. The restaurant was fine but also not very special. Very good were the people at the reception, very very friendly, with a little joke every now and then! Thank you.

Lovely Stay. We stayed in a tent for 7 nights on a sea view pitch. 
The site was very busy but we weren't impacted by that on our pitch.

name: Camping Le Soleil - Esparron de Verdon - Provence
location: 1000 Chemin de la Tuili√®re, 04800 Esparron-de-Verdon, France
comments:
That's my second year here, and I just love it. Really nice showers and toilets, awesome view points from all the camp...
CONS : Installing your tent here is really hard due to the ground hardness.
Nothing has changed! Still like in my childhood. Really love this area :)
Lovely spot, awesome facilities and a great atmosphere!

Paradise!

We've been coming to Camping Le Soleil from the UK every year for the last 15 years and are looking forward to coming again this July! We have tried all forms of camping - in a tent prior to the arrival of children, in the wonderful mobile homes when they were babies and we then decided to buy a caravan.  The facilities available for all forms of camping are excellent. Our children love it too and find different things to do each year as they grow.  Swimming in the lake is divine when we're not windsurfing or canoeing, the pizzas in the restaurant are superb and the friendly staff make our stay a joy. Roll on July.......

My family spent three glorious weeks in this little corner of paradise in 2015 and can't wait to go back for more this year.  There's loads to do like swimming in the warm lake, canoeing in the gorge, cycling, walking, great market at Riez, strolling into the village and then boules and nice pizzas in the evening.  Very helpful staff who keep the site clean and attractive.  Excellent showers and toilets.  Highly recommended although we really should keep it a secret.

Camping Parc De Pramousquier is een erg leuke terrassen camping. Bij aankomst wordt je geholpen door erg aardig en behulpzaam personeel. Het sanitair is basic maar zeer schoon en alles werkt naar behoren. De plaatsen zijn wisselend van grote en niet allemaal waterpas recht. Aan de bovenzijde van de camping is een mooie ruime plaats voor grote campers en caravans. Vanaf een aantal plaatsen is het uitzicht over de Middellandse zee prachtig.
Elke morgen is er vers brood in de camping "supermarkt" verkrijgbaar, even een dag van te voren bestellen is handig. De camping winkel biedt alle basis behoeften. Het restaurant van de camping is een aanrader. Lekker eten voor een redelijke prijs in een gezellig restaurant met erg leuke bediening!

Eigenlijk is het enige nadeel van deze camping is dat er geen water tap punten zijn naast de sanitaire gebouwen. Veel sjouwen met water dus...

Acceptant les chiens dans le camping il n'y a absolument rien pour lui donc assez compliqu√©.
Par contre pour tout se qui est affaire franchement ranger tout par se qui tout se qui est vole sa y va en plus de sa si vous allez voir l'accueil vous aller voir comme quoi le personnelle sens fou compl√®tement. 

Alors la conclusion:
Honn√™tement se n'est pas un camping √† aller pour les vacances se vraiment un camping pour se qui veule pas du tout parle ou partir visite les grandes ville et encore il y a beaucoup de vole.

comments: We have just spent a fantastic week in this friendly campsite. Although the pitch for our family sized tent was small the campsite was good in every other way. I do recommend this place, and just: getting the slightly bigger bungalows (if there are enough people), they are better spaced apart and tend to have better views üòâ
Stayed here for 3 mths last year had a fantastic time beautiful weather, lovely beach close walk away, would recommend it.
There's a small shop where you can buy food, water, coke and bathing accessories. They even have fresh bread (baguettes) and croissants! And very friendly people.

name: Camping Les Palmiers
location: L'ayguade, Rue du Ceinturon, 83400 Hy√®res, France
comments: Very bad animation, hosts they cannot sing and only rum yelling. Not to recommend. Too loudly.

Amazing!. Thank you for the great break!!! We will definitely come back. It was the third time we stayed at Les Pelmiers and we love it! We come from London by car and it is always worth this long journey.

FIX THE INTERNET!!. Nice community and very nice staff.  Would be nice to have some additional sandwich, panini selections at the restaurant.  Our biggest complaint is the internet.  The download speed is 0.3 to 0.5 mb which is absolutely slow.  This wouldn't be a complaint if it were complimentary but it isn't.  You have to pay 7 euro per day per device to get speeds slower than dial up is stupid.  There is a free wifi but you have to walk up to the office to get it or have a cabin close enough to receive it.  There are 4 hotspots throughout the camp and all 4 of them are equally slow and have continous (every 3 to 5 minutes) disconnections.  Like I said it wouldn't be a complaint but for the fact we are paying for it.  I've had better free internet in a cheap budget hotel.  Staff has been quick to fix issues in the cabin but the internet company they have contracted with is not up to par.  It seems the most problems are on the weekend when the crowds come, once again not a complaint if it were free.  But if I'm paying 200 euro a month so we can connect 3 devices....one would expect the money paid would equate into legitimate service.  At 50 euro a month I could get high speed wifi and connect multiple devices.  Right now the internet provider is taking our money and not providing the contracted services.
Attractive bassin,  comfortable houses, clean coastline.

This camping has a nice swimming pool, but the height of the wood bridges is too low, and all of the members of our family could notice it when we got bumped in our heads by passing under the bridges and emerging from the water. They have many rules to follow to access the swimming pool, including no water toys are permitted in the pool. The swimming pool and the fitness center is open from 10:00 am to 19:00 hs. The treadmill was not working. There is no internet connection in the mobile homes, which was very inconvenient. Contrary to the stated in their website and by the staff, internet connection was not working for us around or within the reception building (I tried two different laptop computers, one iPad and the newer iPhone 6 Plus without success, which all of them working at McDonalds). Despite of my claims, staff at the reception said they could do nothing, and that they had their last revision of internet some weeks ago, and have to wait until next revision. Another staff copied from her mobile phone an IP address, and told us to use it, without further explanation about how to do that (she said she was not an IT expert).  Not helpful at all. The camping is next to an airport, and some times you hear the planes really loud (this was not a problem for us, though). Having to do the inventory of cutterly was a time-consuming task for the first day, to say the least, mainly because  of the language (it was in french) and the lack of internet connection. When we took it to the reception, they told us they had an english version. We had to make an appointment before leaving, so they could check that we have not taken the spoons (or the air conditioning). I suppose that a security woman at the entrance was not trained in customer care, and was always quick to point out the rules of the establishment. On the positive side, there is a nice amusement park in the nearby (Cote d¬¥Azur amusement park), which opens from 20:00 to 01:00 am

comments: Wir haben den Campingplatz besucht und er hat uns sehr gut gefallen !!! Sch√∂n zu sehen, mit wie viel Schwei√ü und Liebe lauter kleine Oasen entstehen. Das neue Badehaus wird toll !!! Ich kam im August 2014 auf dem Platz, weil ich die Extremerfahrung des Dauercampen erfahren wollte. Ich blieb den ganzen Winter und Sommer √ºber auf dem Platz und war positiv √ºberrascht.

Parzelle 76 liegt im hinteren, etwas abgelegeneren Bereich des Platzes, aber dennoch gut erreichbar am Hauptweg. Auch der Unterverteiler f√ºr den Strom ist nur wenige Meter entfernt, falls mal eine Sicherung fliegen sollte, was aber nie der Fall war.

Positiv f√§llt auf, dass sich Familie Huttner seit einiger Zeit um den Platz auch mal richtig k√ºmmert und alle Hebel in Bewegung setzt, damit sich etwas tut.

Das neue Waschhaus ist leider immernoch nicht fertig, was bereits f√ºr Mitte 2015 geplant war ‚Äì diversen √Ñmtern sei dank kann man dort immernoch nicht duschen etc. (Aber ich glaube daran, dass es irgendwann mal fertig wird.)

Alles in allem ist es ein sehr angenehmer Platz, bei dem man sich auch mal an den einen oder anderen Nachbarn wenden kann, wenn es ein Problem gibt ‚Äì egal was.
Solange man wei√ü, wie man die Leute am besten ‚Äûanpacken‚Äú muss, sprich wei√ü, wie man mit wem umgeht, ist das alles recht einfach.
Ja, wir Dauercamper sind eine eigene Familie ;-)

Insgesamt blicken wir auf eine sch√∂ne Zeit in Olching zur√ºck, die nun aus Gr√ºnden der Rentabilit√§t und Entfernung zum Wohnort leider zu Ende geht.

Einfachere Gem√ºter, die sich bei Tankstellenkaffee, schon vor Begeisterung kaum halten k√∂nnen, m√∂gen sich hier im Himmel w√§hnen. Menschen mit einem gesunden Sinn f√ºr Sauberkeit und Hygiene wenden sich mit Grausen. Man mag sich kaum vorstellen, wie es bei Huttners zuhause aussieht, wenn man f√ºr diese Zumutung auch noch Geld bezahlen muss.

Bleiben wir mal realistisch. Von 5 Sternen sind wir noch etwas entfernt, aber der Weg dahin ist definitiv erkennbar. Die Fam. Huttner tut alles daf√ºr und lenkt den Platz in die richtige Richtung. Mein ausschlaggebender Faktor f√ºr die positive Bewertung ist der Wohlf√ºhl-Aspekt des Platzes. Es herrscht eine (wie ich als Neuling in den letzten 1 1/2 Jahren erfahren durfte) absolute Hilfsbereitschaft unter den Campern. Den Baufortschritt des neuen Badehauses bekomme ich aus n√§chster N√§he mit und bin mir sicher, dass nach Fertigstellung auch die letzten Kritiker verstummen werden. Den Vorwurf, der Verein wurde ‚Äûvom Platz geekelt‚Äú kann ich (als ehem. Mitglied) so nicht stehen lassen. Ganz im Gegenteil war Hr. Huttner sogar an einer weiteren Zusammenarbeit mit regelm√§√üigem Gedankenaustausch interessiert. Daf√ºr, dass der Vorstand geschlossen zur√ºcktritt und sich niemand bereiterkl√§rte die √Ñmter zu √ºbernehmen, kann der Eigent√ºmer nichts.

Ich weiss ja nicht wer sich solche √Ñu√üerungen anmasst.  Aber manche Leute beleidigen ja gerne √∂ffentlich. Ich bin seit 10 Jahren hier und es gibt keinen sch√∂neres fleckerl . Und die Fam. Huttner hab ich noch niemals unkorrekt erlebt.

Virtually everything is charged for as an extra - an 8 minute shower costs as does hot water for your washing up (there were no plugs there - not sure if they were charged for too!). There aren't many toilets, and they are basically clean, but very tired looking. Having then moved to a much better and cheaper campsite, there seemed to be a great mismatch between price and experience. But if you need an urgent stop near Munich for a night, this will do.

comments:
I'll sound off with saying I would recommend this campsite. However there is very little in the way of entertainment for kids (or adults to be honest), the pool closes at 7PM and you have pay for WiFi. With how expensive the places are, the WiFi price isn't that bad but it's a bit weird to not have it included. 
On the other hand, the campsite is walking distance away from a small, secluded beach, has a pretty good and relatively cheap restaurant and it's pretty quiet. 
Room for improvement but alright as it is.

name: Camp Gabriel

name: Camp Marina - GSP Cebu HQ
comments: Not the best campsite. However, it certainly is the most convenient. Despite the relatively short distance from JY, the road to get there is driver's nightmare with all the potholes and reckless motorists.
nice for camping and small events.
Nice please
The environment is so forestry feels. Big trees and greens are everywhere. Nice place to temporarily be away from the noisy and chaotic city.
I enjoyed camping here it was sooo much fun

name: Jomax Peak
location: Don Salvador Benedicto, Negros Occidental, Philippines
comments: The view is nice and the staff are friendly. There are kitchens, cooking area, toilets and shower rooms. But the place is not ideal for overnight stay especially during rainy season. Tents for rent are smelly and moldy. If it's raining and you're lucky enough to have your tent inside the pavilion you'll still have to deal with the rain if you need to use the toilet/shower room as it's not attached to the pavilion. Not for those looking for peace and quiet either as they allow a lot of groups to use the place at one time.
The staff are very accommodating! The price of the structures are reasonable and our stay was worth it üíñüíñüíñ

My family stayed here for 3 days and 2 nights.
If you went here to camp, kanami gd. Staffs are very helpful and accommodating. They always offer and extend there help without being told. The owner is also very approaching, he even ask his staffs to get some woods for our bon fire.

Charge your phone and powerbank... makalaubos gd na ka selfie üòçüòçüòçüòç. Then the next day nag kadto man kmi sa falls.... 45min walk and another 45min goin back.

DisAdvantages .......

Honesly i choose your place  with in 3 spot places in Don Salvador but only regretion is what i feel. Unprofesional and lock of costumer service is what they got. 
We paid the cost of what bill be have even though we are only walk in costumer you should treat us fair also. You know that the canopy is alteady taken but why you tell us that it is available even though its not. Then after 1 hour that we stayed at your place you tell us that the guest who booked the canopy was already thier and we need to transfer to a spot (chair type ) where we feel trush . My G we paid right so you must treat us right also. 
Nakakawalang gana yung ugaling ipinakita nyo at pag trato nyo sa amin . I will not recomend this place to my friends its waste of time and money .

name: Boy Scouts of the Philippines- Camp Marina Grounds
location: Monares St, Cebu City, Cebu, Philippines

name: Bacalla Woods Campsite
location: Ilaya-San Isidro Rd, San Fernando, Cebu, Philippines
comments: Good camping area .offers different trekking site, an hour from Cebu City.

name: Chalet Hill -Babag Campsite
comments: Perfect for weekend get away to connect with nature.

name: Boy Scouts of the Philippines Eastern Visayas Region
comments: A good place for outdoor activities and seminars. Accessible from Capitol and Lahug areas.

This place is nice and it seems that Boy Scouts of the Philippines seems so care for this property, Hope that they will develop this place for lots of purposes, it's just so sad.

Hope that this will be maintained properly just like the girls scouts camp
Great place for camping and trainings, though the hall needs repair.
Its very clean! And its very close to our house
Great place to commune with nature

name: Waddi Bush Resort
location: RRN 201 Koonah Road, Badgingarra WA 6521, Australia
comments: Great place with plenty of space to have fun.

name: Sullivan Campground
comments: Nice park for overnighter. Picnic tables. Toilet. Some shade. Creek. Watch for crocs. Fishing.

name: Miling Camping ground
comments: Great little spot!

name: Big Horse Creek Campground
comments: Really enjoyed camping under the Boabs.

name: Hide Away Campground
location: 401 Shore Rd, Dingwall, NS B0C 1G0, Canada
comments: Cabins, tent lots, RV lots, whatever your preference. Beautiful view of the Aspey mountains! With a gorgeous beach just around the corner (piping plovers live there). Ideal location if you want to explore the highland national park. Their showers are pretty great, and warm up super quick! The owners are very kind and have all sorts of information of things to do in the area :)

This was our first stop on our NS vacation and we could have stayed here the whole time! Clean friendly camping with all the necessary amenities. The grounds is right on  the Aspy river, and the views are breath taking! Witnessed an engagement during sunrise, and I'm sure it was perfect for them. A 12 km sandy beach is a 5 minute drive, and being at the tip of the trail you can go west or east to find hiking and great food stops, or stay in the grounds for fresh oysters and lobster caught daily. 5 stars all day.

Absolutely a must for a get away vacation with your family. We just wrapped up a stay at the farmhouse at Hideaway and had a flawless week our entire family will never forget. The property is clean and comfortable. The location could not be better for proximity to one of the best beaches in the province as far as we are concerned. The water is clean and the warmest we have ever encountered in Nova Scotia. The sand is powder soft and we pretty much had the beach to ourselves the entire week. This is no small beach I might add. We will definitely be booking again next year. Thank you Susan and Alex. Great job!!!

Well run, beautiful campground with a spectacular view.

We stayed here for 1 night as we went around the Cabot Trail. 

We reserved an unserviced site, which was a reasonable size and fairly nicely wooded (we were able to string up a tarp over our tent). Washrooms, water stations, and dish-washing stations were within a minute's walk. The campground was nice and quiet in the evening / overnight, and the view was amazing.

Looking around, it seemed that most of the reservable sites were similarly nice. The prices were some of the best we encountered on our entire maritime road trip, too.

There also appeared to be ample overflow space. If you end up in overflow space, don't worry: while you won't have trees, you'll probably have the best view in the place, looking over the cliff down at the water and across to the mountains.

Washrooms were clean, however be warned that showers do cost $1 / 5 minutes, which is a minor irritant.

The management / owners were excellent! A special thanks to Susan, in the office, who not only directed us to, but called and set up a meeting with, a local mechanic to look at a concern with our vehicle. This was well above and beyond our expectations.

Definitely a great spot to camp along the Cabot trail.

Stunning location & friendly staff. Site was clean & fairly secluded. My wife & I enjoyed a lobster dinner & freshly shucked oysters during our stay (food was purchased & prepared at the camp but we ate it at our site). Would visit again!

name: Meat Cove Campground & Oceanside Chowder Hut
location: 2479 Meat Cove Rd, Capstick, NS B0C 1E0, Canada
comments: Great camp site, especially for those who like to feel like they're camping off the grid. This place is like no other campground I've been to. If you are travelling the Cabot trail this is a must see spot, even if you don't plan to camp over night. There is a chowder hut that has been newly renovated and has a very good menu - I recommend the chowder bowl. This place has free WiFi, showers, toilets, drinking water and they sell ice and fire wood. Otherwise you will want to bring all of the groceries you need as there are no stores near by. There are several hiking trails that have amazing views. The staff are so friendly and helpful. We stayed in site number 25 (pictured is the view of the beach and ocean from site 25). Have fun!

As far as campsites go, it's reasonably priced and not likely to be overbooked so as to need a reservation before hand. Amenities are great with flush toilets, phone charging outlets and wifi. But the real joy is an unobstructed view of a shale cove, scenic mountains, and watching waves roll into the rock beach for hours on end. This was definitely the highlight of our Cape Breton trip.

The view alone is worth the drive there. We had some time to kill before our whale watching tour with Oshan Whale Watch at nearby Bay St. Lawrence, 20 or so minute drive. It was worth seeing it from land and from the boat later. A great place to camp out for sure.
Incredible view! The staff were super friendly and the beach is great for just spending a couple hours on. It can be insanely windy though so beware tenting!

Amazing view and amazing location. Drove to Meat Cove along an unpaved road. There is a campsite here and also cabin rentals. They also have a restaurant. I had the clam chowder, I was a little early so the veggies were a little crunchy. Offered to steam our crab we bought on the wharf on the way to Meat Cove.

name: Phipps Park
location: 2175 SW Locks Rd, Stuart, FL 34997, USA
comments: We have returned to this friendly, laid-back place for six consecutive years. You will have great views of beautiful boats making their way through the locks. The sites are very large, and there is plenty of room to exercise even the not-so-small dog. Most of all, park manager Joe does such an outstanding job of keeping this gem clean, quiet, and safe.

Love this camp ground!!

Wesley Lowell Renzas
Beautiful spot, friendly ranger, super clean bathrooms, an awesome place to stay. This is our second trip and we will be back!

The campground is nestled in a beautiful setting. The whole park was extremely clean and well maintained. The staff was super friendly. Me and my 12 year old loved setting up camp here for the night. Thanks!  More than reasonable camp cost.

I've never felt more unwelcome at a campground.  The guy or ranger who lives there is a complete jerk who takes his job way too seriously, I'll just leave it at that.  I was going to stay but wasn't certain so I left and when I came back, he was on break or whatever so as he instructed me, I took the spot he told me was open and when I did, before I could even get setup, I got a knock on my camper.  I opened my door.  My dog of course being a dog jumps out of the camper and the guy immediately starts laying into me telling me I need to have my dog on a leash at all times!  I'm supposed to put my dog on a leash inside the camper before I open the door?!  Give me a break!  Then, I had a friend coming to visit and when I gave her the code, the one he gave me was wrong (on purpose maybe?, I wouldn't doubt it).  So, I go to try and get him out of his residence (he lives there) and he finally gives me the right code after she had been waiting out there and when she finally was able to come in, there was a truck behind her that also tried to come in and instead of telling the guy in the truck he couldn't come in, he goes off on me like it was my fault!  This is after he gave me the wrong code!  I've never been treated so rudely at a campsite and will never go back because of this jerk.  He lives there and I think he believes he owns the park, not sure.  Usually park Rangers are there to make you feel welcome and appreciative for the business.  Not this guy, he's there to give you an attitude, I would've left but I had no where else to go.  I will NEVER go back as long as that jerk is running the place.  I don't think he's going anywhere living there so I strongly recommend finding another park to camp unless you want to feel like someone is watching your every move.  Definitely not what I was expecting, so glad I'm outta there.

name: Butch's Fishcamp & RV Park
comments: Hometown Bar On The Water In Okeechobee Florida. Reasonable Prices. Good Service.

I live here and it's peaceful. New owners are doing great things with the park. I see a negative review about the park and they are only upset because they were ran out for selling drugs. Good, decent owners and management who care for the park.
Cost of beverage little high. To hot very uncomfortable .

I live here quite  peaceful..
A real reaxliny  placeto be.
Great place under going new management pretty nice new food wagon and bar coming soon

name: Treasure Coast RV Resort
location: 2550 Crossroads Pkwy, Fort Pierce, FL 34945, USA
comments: Treasure Coast Rv park stands only with their compilation! They are the best RV park that we have ever been to.  The pool, bathrooms, laundry rooms and the ground are immaculate. The landscaping is impeccable. Diane in the office is the best one to work with. The other girls are good but Diane is the one who can get stuff done. The campers are friendly and there are many wonderful activities.
This is such a beautiful place. It's very clean and so far everyone seems friendly.

Nice Property!!  I was planning on staying here and visit with my father, However, He reminded me that the camp had some strict rules which I respected, or so I thought (I can appreciate other peoples property) But when I have a guy approach me on a golf cart give me a EXTREMELY hard time because I am driving through the park because Im a visitor and I shouldn't be driving through the property as visitor... And THREATEN ME... telling me he would CALL THE COPS because Im driving through the park?  Barney Fife  seems to really be excessive. So If you want to stay a a camp full of "rules"  You will love this place. Mandatory Fun is at 5pm.. Oh, and stay off the lawn..
Clean paved sites. Super friendly residents.  Lots of activities

Great place!! Friendly staff and very well maintained. All paved streets with excellent concrete pads and hookups. Pet walk area was a bit inconvenient other wise I would have given 5 stars. We will definitely return.

name: Water's Edge RV Resort
comments: The summer rate was reasonable. It is a smaller park, but very well taken care of. All of the lots are on level brick pavers. You couldn't hear the highway at all from inside the camper. The next time we are in town if a spot is available, I wouldnt hesitate to stay there again.

4-13-16 - What a gem!!! Generous sites - pool - boat ramp - wonderful sunsets from the palapa by the canal - we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Air Boat ride just up the street a few miles - pulled pork, barbeque at a little trailer. Great experience would recommend highly.
Very pretty, clean, staff is great, nice pool, clubhouse is very nice. On the Okeechobee canal‚ò∫

Beautiful, quiet facility on the northeast shore of the rim canal surrounding Lake Okeechobee. Sites are all full hookups with paver stones, are spacious and landscaped. There is good shade except mid day. They have a large, nice pool and clubhouse, clean restrooms and wifi. Picnic tables and a chair swing are in a large expanse of shaded lawn with a bonfire area, next to a petanque court and a horseshoe pit. It's a great place to enjoy nature.
There it's a nice boat launch, fishing area with a cleaning table  A chickee but is by the water with comfortable chairs, end tables and a swing for reading, napping our enjoying the sunset with a cool beverage.
The staff is extremely friendly and attentive. They participate in Passport Amwrica and Good Sam discount clubs.
The only drawback is that "town" is about 10 miles away.

name: Fort Pierce / Port St. Lucie KOA
location: 1821 Old US Hwy 1, Fort Pierce, FL 34946, USA
comments: We brought a new RV from Winnibeago back to our Miami office and stopped overnight to recharge. Gina at the front desk couldn't be nicer. Great location for the price.
Just a gravel yard, but nice people. No pool, no beach shuttle

Great staff the manager Nadine is wonderful if any problems willing to accommodate and rectify the situation immediately.  The owner Barry is wonderful and very pleasant cares about the park.  Wonderful place to stay love the sound of the train!!  Shopping, restaurants and liquor store within walking distance.
Do not stay here.  There is no pool and no security.  The back gate was left open all day and night.  Cars were cutting through from the road that ran behind the campground.  Also, no amenities.
Very quiet restrooms were nice and clean.. Love that the marina and beach was there. They even had enough room for our truck... Thank you and will diffently be back.

name: Road Runner Travel Resort
location: 5500 St Lucie Blvd, Fort Pierce, FL 34946, USA
comments:
Love this place! It's quiet, friendly, the spots are large enough for anything and it's very close to anywhere you'd like to go. The beach is only minutes away but the surrounding area is a nice rural look. 

There is a pool, tennis court, shuffle board, basketball court and a community fire pit. (Fires are not permitted anywhere but designated camp spots. Check with front desk or website for details.) There is also a shower house with 3 private showers, 3 toilets and 4 sinks. It's nice and tiled and clean. A laundry is available with varying sizes of washers and dryers. Bring your own laundry detergent or buy at the camp store, there are no machines to buy any. The machines take quarters, which are available at the camp store. There is also an ATM there, as well as some camping essentials and odds and ends a person may need.  

The spots include rental units,rustic cabins, pull this, spots for tv's and tents.
Very impressed. Immaculately Clean place and staff is super friendly/helpful. We definitely will have to stay here again. The Coyote Grill is a definite must try. The food is super yummy!

This is a very clean and we'll managed park. Location is quiet yet close to the beaches, Ft. Pierce inlet and other amenities. Camp store is nice and well stocked with groceries and RV supplies. I was very impressed with this place!

Parked my extra vehicle in their secure area which had a sign " not responsible for belongings"!  Had to fill out paperwork and got chewed out by the desk lady. I understand the need for rules but someone on their board is making rules that assume everyone needs to be treated like a child. We won't be staying there again.
Very family friendly place. The villas are very clean and up to date. All of the staff are very nice and helpful. Very nice get away.

name: Port St Lucie RV Resort
location: 3703 SE Jennings Rd, Port St Lucie, FL 34952, USA
comments: Lots of shopping centers and highways surround this very well kept campground. 20, 30 & 50 amp service posts are keenly placed on every level concrete slab. All connections from RV to facility utilities were easy runs to clean and secure hook-ups. Local area activities in all directions outside of resort. Laundry facilities and pool on location including a picnic table at each site. Ask for shaded trees if possible. Outside signage is dwarfed by signage for storage facility. Look for gates and lots of RVs to narrow search to entrance. Full circle or 8 mph race track loop with one way road best describes this resorts traffic way with back in spots at about every 25 to 30 feet of each other allowing  space between neighbors. Very quiet camping guests while we stayed here in late April. Did not use cable or WiFi. We did not use pool or other facilities but they appeared well maintained. We stayed 3 nights. Nice place.
Excellent. A quiet and completely clean place. The management is very friendly and you can feel family atmosphere.
Been staying there off and on for 3 years, pool is great,plenty of spaces, people are friendly and price is fair.

The park was decent, but the new management seems to operate with the belief that the guests are "the enemy". A lot of dumb signs telling you what you can't do. They make you feel unwelcome and as if helping you is a burden.
The wifi is better closer to the clubhouse but all in all this wonderful place!

name: Okeechobee KOA Resort
location: 4276 US Highway 441 South, Okeechobee, FL 34974, USA
comments: We absolutely loved our little cabin at this campground. My kids had so much fun roasting marshmallows and just relaxing for the weekend. We honestly didn't leave our site much because we were just so relaxed and happy to there. I'd definitely recommend KOA for camping and if you want to do a little less ruffing it.. the cabins are the way to go.. beds off the ground and an ac.. that's all we needed and we were happy.
It's very clean, the staff is super friendly. The other guests are great. We've made some great friends. And at night the shanty is a blast.

Everything and everyone has been great. Our toddler twins have enjoyed everyone saying hello to them on our walks around the KOA.  Friendly staff and visitors. Great amenities for family fun and plenty of adult only amenities. Conveniently located and clean restrooms/laundry facilities throughout. I would definitely stay again!
I have stayed in both the dry cabins and the deluxe cabins and loved every minute of it. This location is super pet friendly as well. Can't wait to return for another visit!

This park has ‚ÄúA‚Äù & ‚ÄúC‚Äù rated sites.  All sites are clean, well maintained and the bath houses are clean.  I would stay here again, however I would consider where I would park my rig next time.  The problem is not KOA‚Äôs making but effects weekday campers.  The sites along the southwest side of the park (the first two streets when you drive in have deluxe sites) is located next to a RV repair yard doing major repairs all weekdays.  The sound of air drills, staplers, grinders and what not drown out any peace and quiet you would expect.

name: Big Lake Lodge & Rv's
comments: I stayed here with my family. The first day I arrived it was nice.  I returned after Christmas vacation to find all my stuff gone through and I was told I was moving from my original rental we agreed apon . So I reluctantly did. Moving into a camper they provider for 200.00 a week. I rarely had lights because the battery would die. The water had so much bleach that it bleached our clothes. This includes the water you shower in. It burnt our eyes. My daughter cried for almost an hour one night. I believe all this was done to cover up the feces smell that covered the camp ground some days. I just hope their properly disposing of the raw sewage. Several of the older people Thanked  me for addressing this issue. My wife done a sex offender search and they had one residing in the park and he still does. They seem to have no problem with that even though one of his charges was children pornagraphy.  I find that very disturbing. Then the last day/night we were there we told them we were leaving. They came and and inspected the camper. They were pleased. Until 830 at night, when they came knocking on my camper demanding 300.00 more dollars. Saying they were prorating a month. Which we never rented month to month. We rented week to week for 200.00 and i always paid them. They are crooks!! They done some friends of mine the exact same way. Threw them out over night with a child and his wife being pregnant. Left them with no place to go because they told them they were moving in a few days as well. This is not how you do buisness!! They also own a few others. Please be aware.
Ok location, great manager
Great find. The owner and her staff are amazing. Best spot for a Florida Sunset.
very safe ..family oriented ...the owners are wonderful ...

Visited this RV resort last week expecting to find a large crowded RV camp. I found a small very quiet, nice and friendly resort with hosts who were friendly and helpful.  Stores, gas station, market,  mechanic shop, etc.  all within a two block distance.  Great sunsets, good fishing from the docks, I would go back and will be back soon.  Mike

name: Pitchford's RV
location: 3830 NE Indian River Dr, Jensen Beach, FL 34957, USA
comments: A little piece of heaven! Very casual and lots of room. Staff always goes out of their way if a concern arises. Walking distance to downtown Jensen and many restaurants and shops as well. Water views and down to earth people. No stress and always welcoming!
Great spot with great views. Quiet and within walking distance to many restaurants and shops.
A wonderful location. An Eclectic crowd and very nice people for the most part. The staff are spectacular.
Great location. Fabulous views.
No amenities but nice and quiet. Outstanding location.

name: Vantage Oaks RV Park
comments: It's a great place to stay. Quiet clean park off the beaten path. Very relaxing. üëç

If you've seen one trailer park you have seen them all. It seems quite and people that live there seem to care about where they live at which plays a big part. I'm giving it a four star cause it's still a trailer park
Unfortunately The Mobile Homes Are Entirely Too Close To Each Other, The Grounds Weren't Kept Up Very Well At All & Not One Individual, Man Nor Woman Ever Waved or Gave A Polite Passing Smile...
Quiet RV park affordable rate (lowest in the Okeechobee area
Its nice if you want peice and quiet

name: Zachary Taylor RV Resort
comments: Pretty crowded, but well maintained, nice people and pool. Just put in all new docks. Campground located right by the lock to enter lake Okeechobee. Great bass fishing and speck fishing.
Lots of Great Bass and Catfish. And Bird watching.
It down to earth and friendly its also a 55 and older park we r just visiting
Nice place. Expensive
Amazing park. Very clean and well maintained.  Totally hassle free, will return.

name: Savannas Recreation Area
location: 1400 E Midway Rd, Fort Pierce, FL 34982, USA
comments: Wonderful place and it was a very enjoyable experience. We went during the week so it wasn't very crowded and at night it was peaceful and quiet. We definitely would recommend it.

Recently completed Indian Hills Recreation Area is located off Savannah Road between Indian River Drive and US1.  The area boasts picnic areas, walking trails and a trail around the perimeter of the newly expanded retention pond with workout stations.  Parking is located on both sides of Savannah Road: on the south side and on the north side behind the animal control building.  Both parking areas are accessible via a walking path that crosses Savannah Road. Beautifully landscaped and hidden away, it is uncrowded and lightly used so far, but as the news of the renovations become more widely known, I expect this park to become a favorite of locals.
There is a nice paved jogging path towards the back of the campground and fun playground for kids. The area is quiet and scenic. There is also a dog park in the area.

The campground was located all the way south of US1. It is gated at night with a pin pad for entry... and open to public during the day..The park was large and very well-maintained. The RV section of the park did not have a lot of privacy but had numerous fifth wheels and campers.The lot size was decent. The speed limit is 10 mph and everyone will make sure that that is obeyed.. so be cautious when driving through. The center of the RV park has a large circle seating area for bonfire fire pit some type of group activity. There was an office at the front that is a trailer home and a Nother trailer home in the center that two local sheriffs deputy's reside in. There are a few employees all that seemed friendly. In the center of the park there is a concrete building with the men and women's facility, two toilets & two showers that were well-kept. Laundry facility that has coin-operated machines. There are camping sites available for people with tense. They have three separate choices for campsites. All of the prices were affordable and offer optional amenities. There was small playground with slide and swings that is surrounded by a chain-link fence. There is a dog walk area that is fenced in chain-link is well. There are small canals that run throughout the park. The lands are natural savanna preserve not to be disturbed. There was a mixture of people from the RV park to the campsites. There were retired couples with small pets to families with young children to early 20s. Everybody says it was very friendly and sociable with each other. I recommend this for a safe clean facility that is large and has a variety of ages.

It is a beautiful place and the people very friendly.  The place is a wildlife sanctuary so it is important to realize that and respect the wildlife as we are guests on their preserve.  It is a bird watchers paradise and there are alligators!  Pets must be leashed at all times and please respect others and the native species by picking up after them.  Also don't feed the animals.  It is tempting but this is a wilderness preserve and we should attempt to observe but don't disturb!  This campground has hook-ups for RV's and campsites. It has laundry facilities a historic small house that serves as the office, merger camp store and lounge.  The wi-if doesn't work well but maybe it shouldn't - come to relax and unwind!  The bathrooms are ok not fancy but relatively clean and would be cleaner if each guest cleaned up after themselves - hint. It is a special place and if you can take time to "smell the coffee" and relax you will love being here. Tell them Robert sent you! Hope to be back at some point!

name: Tanglewood Village
comments: This is a great place to stay, if you are 55 or older, it is quite and the people are very friendly.
Its not to big nice people a lake swimming pool close to stores .
Peaceful GREAT PEOPLE AND MY BEST FREIND LIVES THERE JOE

name: St. Lucie South
comments: Nice site (RV8) but tons of ants. Gonna start the battle later after visit to Walmart. Will re-review after two week stay.
What a well kept secret. This campground is right at the dam. It's very peaceful and quiet. The staff are very helpful and nice.
This education center was not on the map. There is a host of information at the visitor center. You can walk over he lock and hike a small naure trail that is abundant in butterflies.
Loved this little campground!
quiet and peaceful small family park.

name: Living Hope Camp Foundation
location: Living Hope Camp, Taroy, wangal, La Trinidad, 2601 Benguet, Philippines
comments: has most of the needed amenities, but it does not have a covered court
Best camp site ever!!

name: D. N. Flores Mango Farm and City Mountain Resort
location: Sitio Calaungan, Nagyubuyuban, San Fernando, La Union, Philippines

name: The Manor at Camp John Hay
location: Camp John Hay, Ordonio Dr, Camp John Hay, Baguio, 2600 Benguet, Philippines
comments: I gave it 4 stars for the greenery and space, hotel is quite old and pricey and their water smells funky (maybe because of a rusty water tank). Our house has better toilets. Hahaha! I've stayed at much better hotels. Staff are not that pleasant unlike the other Baguio hotels I've stayed in. I hope  they do something about it and upgrade some of their fixtures. I've been here plenty of times and they never changed. I'd prefer Le Monet, much newer. But then again, The Manor is The Manor.

The best place to stay in Baguio. Offers peace and quiet, and the dining is just 5 star! All rooms are clean and functional, and you do really get what you pay for. I also recommend that you would avail of membership if you plan on visiting Baguio at least twice or thrice a year. It is also a great place for business meetings, and for family trips. If you might as well have the budget, book immediately! Specially if you plan to stay in Baguio during the months of December or February-March.
Warm and welcoming. They always greet you and make you feel like manor is your home. Great food.
One of the best hotels I have stayed. The rooms are big and spacious. You will experience its ambience of Baguio. Also they have a lot of amenities.
Would love to come back.. Very nice place. The food is oh so yummy

name: Saint Alfonso's Place
location: # 36 Purok 7,, Bakakeng Norte Road, Baguio, 2600 Benguet, Philippines
comments:
Now I have more reason to go to Baguio because of this place! I love the cozy ambiance, very good and attentive staff! The rooms are clean and well maintained. Home away from home.

Plus a very big bonus, the super yummy food prepared by the owner itself. Soo good I don't want to go back to Manila anymore. 
Definitely value for money!

A place just like home. Good service pleasant and attentive staff, excellent food they serve best gourmet and hearty dishes made especially by the owner. Pet friendly place too... 
My favorite place to stay in baguio :)

Saint Alfonso's Place is a beautiful place to relax and stay in. If you are the adventurous type, it would be a great place to stay, to feel Baguio's weather in all its glory. At the same time, Saint Alfonso's Place has a sense of home and coziness that I could not feel elsewhere. I would strongly recommend this place to friends and family who want to relax and feel comfortable in Baguio.
Just worth the price.
Very homelike experience.

name: Kotakizawa Camping Ground
comments:
Pros: A free campsite next to a gorgeous river. Kids can play in the shallow water. Has toilets and a roofed table for bad weather. 

Cons: Not many spaces, no vending machines or stores nearby. Can fill quickly during summer vacation. 

My family's usual camping/day camping area.

name: New Kirifu campsite
comments: Camped here for G.W. 2017.  There are several cabins just big enough to sleep in.  We pitched a tent (a few spots with electrical service [additional cost]).  Stayed in the upper field, with only one porta-potty.  Fairly nice place with a lot of free wood for campfires, just walk into the woods.  Most other campers were courteous of others (one group of 20STH males, not).  Most sites are not shaded (helps dry out tent and tarp).  Watch out for deer droppings!
I used this caravan site early on Nov. Instead of freezing temperature we monopolied a sky full of stars , night view of Nikko, and silence of a forest. Warmth of fire was special.
looks nice.
